intro: Asemeia leptopsis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved asemeia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or white in color. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Asemeia leptopsis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and scrub habitats.
